segment.source: How to Install MED-V Client
segment.target: How to Install MED-V Client

segment.source: How to Install MED-V Client
segment.target: How to Install MED-V Client

segment.source: How to Install MED-V Client
segment.target: How to Install MED-V Client

segment.source: In a deployment package-based scenario, the MED-V client installation is included in the deployment package and installed directly from the package.
segment.target: In a deployment package-based scenario, the MED-V client installation is included in the deployment package and installed directly from the package.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: When using a deployment package that does not include an image, ensure that the image is uploaded to the Web or pushed to the pre-stage folder prior to installing the deployment package.
segment.target: When using a deployment package that does not include an image, ensure that the image is uploaded to the Web or pushed to the pre-stage folder prior to installing the deployment package.

segment.source: To install a deployment package
segment.target: To install a deployment package

segment.source: Do one of the following:
segment.target: Do one of the following:

segment.source: Download the MED-V package from the Web.
segment.target: Download the MED-V package from the Web.

segment.source: Insert the deployment USB or DVD into the host drive.
segment.target: Insert the deployment USB or DVD into the host drive.

segment.source: If MED-V does not launch automatically, double-click MED-VAutoInstaller.exe.
segment.target: If MED-V does not launch automatically, double-click MED-VAutoInstaller.exe.

segment.source: A dialog box appears listing the components that are already installed and those that are currently being installed.
segment.target: A dialog box appears listing the components that are already installed and those that are currently being installed.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If a version of the Microsoft Virtual PC that is not supported exists on the host computer, a message will appear telling you to uninstall the existing version and run the installer again.
segment.target: If a version of the Microsoft Virtual PC that is not supported exists on the host computer, a message will appear telling you to uninstall the existing version and run the installer again.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If an older version of the MED-V client exists, it will prompt you asking whether you want to upgrade.
segment.target: If an older version of the MED-V client exists, it will prompt you asking whether you want to upgrade.

segment.source: Depending on the components that have been installed, you might need to reboot.
segment.target: Depending on the components that have been installed, you might need to reboot.

segment.source: If rebooting is necessary, a message appears notifying you that you must reboot.
segment.target: If rebooting is necessary, a message appears notifying you that you must reboot.

segment.source: If necessary, reboot the computer.
segment.target: If necessary, reboot the computer.

segment.source: When the installation is complete, MED-V starts and a message appears notifying you that the installation is complete.
segment.target: When the installation is complete, MED-V starts and a message appears notifying you that the installation is complete.

segment.source: Log in to MED-V using the following user name and password:
segment.target: Log in to MED-V using the following user name and password:

segment.source: Type in the domain name and user name followed by the password of the domain user who is permitted to work with MED-V.
segment.target: Type in the domain name and user name followed by the password of the domain user who is permitted to work with MED-V.

segment.source: Example: "domainnameusername", "password"
segment.target: Example: "domainnameusername", "password"

segment.target: Related topics
